skill.name: devflow-tdd-enforcer
skill.description: Enforces TDD order in TASKS.md - Tests MUST be marked complete before Implementation tasks. Blocks violations in real-time.
skill.summary: Enforces TDD order in TASKS.md - Tests MUST be marked complete before Implementation tasks. Blocks v...
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: Pure configuration skill containing only YAML/markdown definitions. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond Claude Code's default. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Enforce TDD order in task management
content.value_statement: Teams often mark implementation tasks complete before tests, breaking Test-First Development principles. This guardrail blocks real-time violations by detecting when implementation tasks are checked off before corresponding test tasks.
actual_capabilities: Detects when implementation tasks are marked complete before test tasks using regex patterns
Blocks file saves that violate TDD order with exit code 2
Supports skip conditions via @skip-tdd-check comment, session skip, or SKIP_TDD_ENFORCER=1 env var
Validates TASKS.md files in devflow/requirements/**/ directory
Provides clear blocking messages with required actions and constitutional basis
limitations: Only validates TASKS.md files, not actual test files on disk
Cannot verify test quality or coverage beyond presence in task list
Requires Claude Code's PreToolUse hook mechanism to function
Does not generate test templates or implementation code

use_cases.title: Enforce testing standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all developers follow TDD principles across large teams by blocking policy violations before they occur

use_cases.title: Maintain code quality gates
use_cases.description: Automatically enforce test-first development as a prerequisite for merging implementation tasks

use_cases.title: Build testing habits
use_cases.description: Stay disciplined about writing tests first without relying on willpower alone

prompt_templates.title: Quick enforcement check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my TASKS.md follows TDD order. Tell me which tasks are in the wrong sequence.

prompt_templates.title: Understand blocking reason
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain why my TASKS.md edit was blocked. Show me the correct TDD order.

prompt_templates.title: Skip TDD check
prompt_templates.prompt: Add @skip-tdd-check marker to my TASKS.md so I can proceed with this hotfix.

prompt_templates.title: Review task sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current TASKS.md and verify all test tasks are marked complete before corresponding implementation tasks.

output_examples.input: I marked my implementation task as done but Claude blocked me
output: TDD Violation Detected - Implementation task marked complete before test task
Line T015: Implement user authentication marked [x]
Line T016: Test user authentication still [ ]
Required action: Mark T016 as complete FIRST, then mark T015
Alternative: Add @skip-tdd-check comment if this is an emergency hotfix

best_practices: Keep test tasks immediately before implementation tasks with sequential numbering
Use @skip-tdd-check comments for documented exceptions like hotfixes
Review the blocking message for constitutional basis and required actions
anti_patterns: Marking implementation tasks complete without corresponding test verification
Removing test tasks entirely to bypass TDD enforcement
Skipping TDD checks routinely instead of following the workflow

faq.question: Does this skill run test files?
faq.answer: No. This skill only validates TASKS.md task ordering. It does not execute or validate actual test files.

faq.question: Can I bypass TDD enforcement?
faq.answer: Yes. Three ways: session skip once, add @skip-tdd-check comment, or set SKIP_TDD_ENFORCER=1 environment variable.

faq.question: Does this work with all test frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill operates at task list level only. It is agnostic to Jest, pytest, or any testing framework.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Safe. This is a configuration-only skill with no executable code. It reads TASKS.md through Claude Code's standard file access.

faq.question: Why was my edit blocked?
faq.answer: Your TASKS.md has an implementation task marked complete while the corresponding test task is still incomplete. Mark the test first, then the implementation.

faq.question: How is this different from test coverage tools?
faq.answer: Test coverage tools measure code percentage. This skill enforces task order in planning documents. Use both together for complete quality assurance.
